comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Surrendered after the Siege of Tsingtau en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siege_of_Tsingtao For cross-referencing images of the Kiautschou (Jiaozhou) Bay Concession, of which Tsingtau (Qingdao) was the capital: "Jiaozhou was romanized as Kiaochow, Kiauchau or Kiao-Chau in English and Kiautschou or Kiaochau." And the Bain Collection has pictures labeled "Kiaotschau" as well en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jiaozhou_Bay_concession See also: de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alfred_Meyer-Waldeck

comment.author: 63860770@N07
comment._content: Thanks pennylrichardsca, we'll add his first name to our record. Thanks for the links artolog. Most people don't realize that Japan was one of the allies of the Triple Entente (France, Great Britain & Russia).
